Class Vehicle

java.lang.Object
com.gradescope.datastructures.Vehicle
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Vehicle>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Boat, Canoe, Coupe, Motorcycle, Sedan
public abstract class Vehicle extends Object implements Comparable<Vehicle>
Abstract base class representing a generic Vehicle.

This class provides common attributes such as price, mileage, and horsepower, along with validation logic. It implements Comparable to allow vehicles to be sorted primarily by price and secondarily by mileage.

This class cannot be instantiated directly. Subclasses must implement their own horsepower validation rules.

  • Constructor Details

    • Vehicle

      public Vehicle(double price, int horsepower, double mileage)
      Constructs a Vehicle with the specified price, horsepower, and mileage. Validation is performed through setter methods.
      Parameters:
      price - the price of the vehicle (must be between 5000 and 50000 inclusive)
      horsepower - the horsepower value (validated by subclass implementation)
      mileage - the mileage of the vehicle (must be non-negative)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if price or mileage are outside valid range

  • Method Details

    • getPrice

      public double getPrice()
      Returns the price of the vehicle.
      Returns:
      the vehicle price in USD

    • setPrice

      public void setPrice(double price)
      Sets the price of the vehicle after validating the value.
      Parameters:
      price - the price to set (must be between 5000 and 50000 inclusive)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if price is outside the allowed range

    • getMileage

      public double getMileage()
      Returns the mileage of the vehicle.
      Returns:
      the mileage in miles

    • setMileage

      public void setMileage(double mileage)
      Sets the mileage of the vehicle after validating the value.
      Parameters:
      mileage - the mileage to set (must be non-negative)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if mileage is negative

    • getHorsepower

      public int getHorsepower()
      Returns the horsepower of the vehicle.
      Returns:
      the horsepower value

    • setInternalHorsepower

      protected void setInternalHorsepower(int hp)
      Sets the internal horsepower field after validation.

      Intended for use by subclasses once their specific validation logic has been applied.

      Parameters:
      hp - the validated horsepower value

    • setHorsepower

      public abstract void setHorsepower(int horsepower)
      Sets the horsepower of the vehicle.

      Subclasses must implement their own validation rules before calling setInternalHorsepower(int).

      Parameters:
      horsepower - the horsepower value to set
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if subclass validation fails

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Vehicle other)
      Compares this vehicle with another vehicle for ordering.

      Vehicles are sorted:

      • Primarily by price (ascending)
      • Secondarily by mileage (ascending)

      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Vehicle>
      Parameters:
      other - the vehicle to compare against
      Returns:
      a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this vehicle is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified vehicle
